tool.name: Minfi Preprocess Quantile

configfiles.configfile:
require("minfi", quietly = TRUE) RGSet <- get(load('$input_rgset'))
GRSet <- preprocessQuantile(RGSet, fixOutliers = TRUE, removeBadSamples = TRUE, badSampleCutoff = 10.5, quantileNormalize = TRUE, stratified = TRUE, mergeManifest = FALSE, sex = NULL)
save(GRSet,file = '$output_grset')

param.name: input_rgset
param.label: RGChannelSet
param.help: These classes represents raw (unprocessed) data from a two color micro array; specifically an Illumina methylation array.

tool.help: The normalization procedure is applied to the Meth and Unmeth intensities separately. The distribution of type I and type II signals is forced to be the same by first quantile normalizing the type II probes across samples and then interpolating a reference distribution to which we normalize the type I probes. Since probe types and probe regions are confounded and we know that DNAm distributions vary across regions we stratify the probes by region before applying this interpolation.
